text: [Music]
hello i am palvi a cloud support
engineer here at the aws office in
bangalore today i am going to show you
how users can request a concurrency
limit increase for the aws lambda
functions and how to identify the
required limit
let's get started
concurrency is the number of requests
that your function is serving at any
given time
before requesting a limit increase you
must understand the requirements for
your use case
multiply your function's average runtime
duration in seconds by the average
number of requests or invocations the
function receives per second
the result is your required concurrency
limit
here are a few other points to consider
before requesting the limit increase
increasing your concurrency limit can
increase the charges on your aws account
if you received four to nine too many
request exception errors verify that
you're not exceeding the burst
concurrency quota
to learn more follow the instructions in
the how do i troubleshoot lambda
function throttling with rate exceeded
and 4 to 9 too many request exception
errors knowledge center article
linked in the knowledge center article
associated with this video
make sure that you review your
concurrent executions metric in the
service quotas dashboard to see your
current concurrency usage
it's a best practice to request a limit
increase at least two weeks before the
increase is needed
if you are using lambda with amazon
cloudfront lambda at h then you must
open a separate quota increase case for
each region
now let's see how we can open a quota
increase case in the service quotas
dashboard for lambda concurrency limit
navigate to the service quota dashboard
from your aws management console
select the service that you want to
increase the limit for
let's choose lambda
here you can see the current utilization
associated with a specific quota and
also its current and default quota value
if you still need a limit increase
select the quota name and choose request
quota increase
enter the quota value required under
change quota value section
choose the request button to submit the
request
now to view the existing quota increase
request select the quota request history
from the left navigation pane of the
service quota dashboard
choose the status of the requested quota
here you can see the status of your
request and the associated support case
link
you can choose the case id to open the
aw support case console
it's a best practice to add the
following details to your support case
for concurrency increase request
the concurrency limit requested
the anticipated average number of
requests that your function will receive
per second
the anticipated highest number of
requests that your function will receive
per second
the anticipated runtime duration
the function memory size
the invocation type event or request
response
the event source
the load test results that explain the
reason why the quota increase is needed
any additional information that will
help us better understand your use case
aws will notify you about the status of
this limit increase request in the aws
support case that you create
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at aws
[Music]
